ai-ps2.10:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ps2.10:1.3_0: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
ai-ps2.10:1.3_1: bowed, sat down to one side,
ai-ps2.10:2.1_0: “Sir, they say that ‘the world is empty’.
ai-ps2.10:2.3_0: “Ānanda, they say that ‘the world is empty’ because it’s empty of self or what belongs to self.
ai-ps2.10:2.4_0: And what is empty of self or what belongs to self?
ai-ps2.10:2.5_0: The eye is empty of self or what belongs to self.
ai-ps2.10:2.6_0: Forms are empty of self or what belongs to self,
ai-ps2.10:2.9_0: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also empty of self or what belongs to self.
ai-ps2.10:3.9_0: empty of self or what belongs to self.
ai-ps2.10:3.10_0: thoughts that are empty of self or what belongs to self.
ai-ps2.10:3.13_0: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also empty of self or what belongs to self.
ai-ps2.10:3.14_0: They say that ‘the world is empty’ because it’s empty of self or what belongs to self.”
